Text: Nathan Kosiba
Population data can be specified by the user
Treatment variable can be manually specified for population data
Population data subset can be specified on user specified conditions
Header N counts will be specified by combining different subgroups available within the population data
Manual groups can be specified by combining different subgroups
Analysis data can be specified by the user
Analysis data subset can be specified on user specified conditions
Treatment variable can be manually specified for analysis data
n counts of values within a variable can be produced
n counts of values within a group of variables can be produced
Total n counts can be added
Total row sort value can be specified by the user
Missing n count handling can be specified including presentation and denominator handling
Missing row sort value can be specified by the user
Dummy values can be specified for categories that need to be presented but may not exist within the data
Counts can be produced as n (%)
When producing n (%), the denominator can be specified using the analysis data
When producing n (%), the denominator can be specified using a particular manually specified subset
When producing n (%), the denominator can be specified using the population data
When producing n (%), the denominator can be specified using grouping of variables
Risk difference including confidence interval can be produced based on specified treatment groupings
Risk difference arguments can be passed forward into prop.test using args parameter
Risk difference can be calculated over user specified cols arguments
Risk difference can be calculated over nested count layers and by variables
The descriptive statistic of n can be produced based on an input variable
The descriptive statistic of mean can be produced based on an input variable
The descriptive statistic of median can be produced based on an input variable
The descriptive statistic of IQR/Q1/Q3 can be produced based on an input variable
The descriptive statistic of standard deviation can be produced based on an input variable
The descriptive statistic of variance can be produced based on an input variable
The descriptive statistic of min can be produced based on an input variable
The descriptive statistic of max can be produced based on an input variable
The descriptive statistic of missing can be produced based on an input variable
Custom descriptive statistics can be produced based on an input variable and a specified formula
Descriptive statistics can be performed across discrete values within a grouping variable or a group of grouping variables
Multiple statistics can be presented in one line (i.e. combining Q1, Q3 or Min, Max)
Decimal precision can be specified by the user
Integer length can be specified by the user
Decimal precision can be dynamically created from analysis data
Integer length can be dynamically created from analysis data
Presentation format can be specified by the user including desired non-numeric text
Strings are built to align per user specification within a display
Descriptive statistic missing values can be set to a user specified string
Shift n counts of values using two variables, a 'from' and a 'to' variable, can be produced
Shift n counts of values within a variable can be produced
Shift n counts of values within a group of variables can be produced
Dummy values for shift counts can be specified for categories that need to be presented but may not exist within the data
Shift counts can be produced as n (%)
For shift counts when producing n (%), the denominator can be specified using the analysis data
For shift counts when producing n (%), the denominator can be specified using a particular manually specified subset
For shift counts when producing n (%), the denominator can be specified using the population data
For shift counts when producing n (%), the denominator can be specified using a grouping of variables
Row labels can be manually specified by the user
Row labels can be nested to put a subgroup within a parent group
Summaries can be stacked on top of one another
Summaries can be sorted based on manual sorting by presentation specified order
Summaries can be sorted based on count based sorting (either ascending or descending) by a specified treatment group
Summaries can be sorted based on alphabetical sorting based on data values
Summaries can be sorted based on a numeric version of the target variable if available
Summary by variables will be sorted by a numeric variable if available and then by factor
Nested layers can be sorted independently using different methods
Independent layers can be sorted using different methods and stacked using common sorting variables
Count layer default formats can be set at the table level
Descriptive statistics layer default formats can be set at the table level
Shift layer default formats can be set at the table level
Option for count layer default formats can be specified by the user
Option for descriptive statistics layer default formats can be specified by the user
Option for shift layer default formats can be specified by the user
Option for a cap on auto precision can be specified by the user
Option for custom descriptive statistics can be specified by the user for use in the table
Option for setting scipen internal option can be specified by the user
Option for setting quantile algorithm choice can be specified by the user
Column headers can be added to the output object
Row breaks can be added between sections based on grouping variables
Row labels can be masked in a hierarchical fashion
A table object is returned in a format that is ready to be cosmetically prepared
Count layers can process a cols argument and separate population data passed from the table level along with normal count layer processing
Count layers can process a cols argument, separate population data, and a defined subset passed from the table level along with normal count layer processing
